name: The Fairmont Dallas

reviews.text: Excellent, solid, business hotel in Downtown Dallas. Walking distance to many great neighborhoods and very close to the Historic District where the JFK Museum is found. Lots of entertainment in that district too. Right across the street is a very high end restaurant called Charlie Palmer. Pricey but well worth it! Also within a 1/4 mile walk of the Dallas Arts District. Dallas Museum is worth it. Great exhibits...nice collection. Modern Art museum is quite quite cool.
reviews.title: Nice Location Downtown...Charming

likes.disliked: — Kinda standard...nothing jumps out at you

reviews.text: The rooms are fine, but not really large. Kind of reminds you of an old style hotel from pre-war. Rooms are in good shape, clean, and latest amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked one of their new Fairmont Gold Suites via Expedia.com, and was a little worried if the pictures and descriptions were 'too good to be true', but we felt the rate was appropriate for a club level - type suite at a luxury hotel (around $400/night). What can I say... I was SOOO impressed with the entire experience!
reviews.title: Pleased with the Fairmont Dallas!

reviews.text: We were escorted to the Gold floor as soon as we got out of our car at valet, and introduced to our private concierge at the Lounge. We were checked in, had dinner reservations made, and got a snack, within minutes of arriving - WOW! The suite was worth every cent - completely brand new everything. Loved the bed - didn't want to get out ever! Having access to the private lounge was the best part - we made it our 'home-away-from-home' over the next few days. My husband used it to get away from me for a few hours to do some work (ha ha), but it worked out nice for me because I used that time to relax and watch some sappy girl movies.
reviews.title: Recommend as a thumbs up

likes.disliked: — Media room printer down + no moderate restaurant

reviews.text: I stayed at the Fairmont for a business conference. From what I heard, Fairmont is supposed to be a superb hotel.
reviews.title: Fairmont is just okay

reviews.text: That was not the case. It is run down and is in need of some updates. They had a few nice amenities, like a flat screen TV, and large rooms, but that was about it. The desk only had one electrical plug for my computer and the bathroom was nice, but needed some deep cleaning. The clock radio was from the 80's. I also noticed some spots on the sheets. They were clean, but had permanent spots.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel

reviews.text: I wouldn't pay that much to stay there for a vacation. It's not worth paying that much for the name. Go down the street to the Westin.
reviews.title: Mixed bag: Lovely Room but...

reviews.text: The hotel is also in a neighborhood without much to do. There were a few nice restaurants, but it is definitely an 'office' area of town.
reviews.title: Excellent Experience

reviews.text: The Fairmont Dallas is a great hotel, and for $149/night, a decent value. I highly recommend it to anyone staying in Dallas.
reviews.title: Repeat Customer!

reviews.text: Location is fantastic - heart of the Art district in downtown Dallas - a mile from the happening spots in the evening at Mcinney Ave; connected to the underground from the lobby of the hotel (was a boon for me as my place of business was 3 blocks away and was walking distance and the underground tunnel system was very convenient and comfortable and safe); for the fitness fanatics, register yourself online in the President's club Loyalty program and get free wireless access and the 24 fitness club (with free apparel once you move up - 10 night stays in a calendar year)
reviews.title: Fantastic Fairmont

reviews.text: In-house restaurant is on the expensive side ($50 and up for a decent dinner), but they do have a cafe that has a limited menu; outside there are a couple of steakhouses within walking distance.
reviews.title: High noise levels and tired rooms mar good service
Fair Enough Fairmont
reviews.text: Outstanding friendly service at the concierge, front desk, and efficient housekeeping.

Impeccable interiors, flat screen tvs in all rooms that I stayed in. Their loyalty progam web interface sucks big time with the Canadian counterparts lagging far behind in updates and transparency of your credits/earnings. You really have no clue of what you earn and they are extremely sloppy with crediting you accurately for the extras...but, the comfortable beds and outstanding service & location makes up for all of that.
reviews.title: Don't Stay Here!
Very pleasant
reviews.text: It sounded like an unmissable opportunity -- a combination of two Fairmont upgrade certificates and a last-minute cancellation at the hotel meant I obtained an enormous king bed suite for the equivalent of $150 a night instead of the $350 a night it should have cost. I should have known it was too good to be true.

description: In Texas we do things in a big way, and The Fairmont Dallas is no exception amongst hotels in Dallas, TX. In this modern city of soaring skyscrapers, The Fairmont Dallas luxury hotel sets the standard for style and elegance. With our ideal location in the heart of the Downtown Dallas Arts District, we are situated just moments from incredible fine dining, shopping, arts and world-class entertainment. Newly redesigned luxurious guest rooms and suites offer warm hospitality, modern décor and that special Texas flair for an unrivaled travel experience. Fairmont Gold, an exclusive boutique lifestyle experience, is designed to fulfill the needs of the discerning business executive and leisure traveler, with elite lounge access and all of the comforts of home. Enjoy The Pyramid Restaurant & Bar’s four-star cuisine and a Starbucks conveniently located on the lobby level.
